duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, manage, and execute the processing of objects and archival materials acquired by the museum through gift, purchase, or loan.
Maintain collection, archival, and exhibit material inventory, and manage collections, archival, and exhibit materials stock replenishment.
Conduct initial assessment for proposed objects or archival materials and develop object or archival housing.
Produce monthly Collections Committee reports that include department updates, object-management reports, and details of proposed acquisitions.
Facilitate care and security of collections at the museum, exhibits, research library, and off-site storage.
Create and implement inventory schedule, and work with other staff on exhibition installations.
Train and supervise the work of ancillary personnel such as other staff, interns, and volunteers when required.
Oversee digitization process with volunteers or grant-funded contractors.
Manage photo orders and requests from the public, and work in partnership with the Outreach and Public Programs Manager to fulfill orders.
Track department volunteer hours and perform other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or certificate in collections management, archives, or library science with a minimum of two (2) years of experience (paid or volunteer); preferred Master’s degree in collections management or library science or equivalent work experience.
